712753f-a.title: Manhattan: 41st Street (West) - 9th Avenue
712753f-a.text:
418 West 41st Street, south side, west of Ninth Avenue. This is an old church, occupied in the 1890's by 2ion Chapel, and was occupied by a Greek congregation after some years of
secular use.
June 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

712749f-b.text:
(1)
West 41st Street, south side, west from (No. 408), but not including Ninth Ave. Shown in the foreground, at N4s. 418-420, is an old church, occupied in the 1890's by 22ion CBhapel, and used later by a Greek

of St. Raphael's R.C. Church.

WWest 41st Street (immediate foreground) south side, between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, showing a clearance extending southward several blocks. Dyer Avenue will be constructed here and form a vehicular approach to the new Lincoln Tunnel. The tenerient seen in the path
of this demolition is No. 424-26 W. 39th Street.
May 15, 1938.
P. L. Sperr,
